sect1.title: Locale support
sect1.para: Keeping with the spirit in which WinMerge was created, I decided one day to diddle with UI localization using resource DLLs. By virtue of that effort, combined with the gracious contributions of several good people, you can now use WinMerge in your own native language.

note.para: The language DLLs allow to using a different interface language than English, but does not change other locale issues (such as how large numbers are broken up, or how words are alphabetized).

If you would like to add your language to the list, look at the on-line documentation for the details on how to do it.

sect2.title: Configuration
sect2.para: In order to change the current UI language, you must do the following:

listitem.para: Download the desired language DLL from the WinMerge download site.
Unzip the downloaded file into the same directory where WinMerge.exe is located. Note that the language DLL has a .lang extension.
Select Language from the View menu
Select your language and click OK

sect2.para: Note that the WinMerge UI instantly updates to the selected language.
